author: El Siglo de Durango
title: Denuncian que director de la Diurna hostiga a docentes para apoyar a un aspirante a la rector\u00eda
text: Denuncian que director de la Diurna hostiga a docentes para apoyar a un aspirante a la Rectoría [SAÚL MALDONADO](/archivo/?q=SAÚL MALDONADO&busqueda=autor) Rafael Mier, aspirante a rector, denunció que el director de la Preparatoria Diurna está amenazando a los maestros con reducirles horas de trabajo si no apoyan a cierto candidato rumbo a la rectoría. Reiteró que en algunas escuelas se están ejerciendo presiones para que apoyen a un determinado aspirante, y aseguró que "esas presiones son claras". Sin embargo, aclaró que existen muchos universitarios que no se dejan amedrentar ni manipular, y que están convencidos de un proyecto con responsabilidad social, decididos a cerrar filas para defender la autonomía universitaria. El aspirante a rector recordó que en 2010, desde el poder legislativo, se intentó imponer una ley orgánica sin la intervención de la universidad, lo cual fue logrado. Por ello, afirmó que los universitarios están preparados para defender esa autonomía. En cuanto a la situación financiera de la Universidad Juárez del Estado de Durango (UJED), Mier reconoció que hay un problema serio, ya que la universidad depende en un 90 por ciento de los recursos federales, y es necesario aumentar la matrícula para obtener mayores ingresos locales. Ese incremento en la matrícula, explicó, puede lograrse con la creación de carreras prioritarias que actualmente la UJED no ofrece. Este viernes comienza el proceso de registro de aspirantes a la rectoría de la Universidad Juárez.

author: News
title: Shades of Sampras as Learner teenager stuns racquet-wrecking Medvedev in early-morning epic
text:
Learner Tien, a 19-year-old American qualifier, has outlasted marathon man Daniil Medvedev in an astonishing Australian Open boilover, sending the three-time finalist spinning out… Learner Tien, a 19-year-old American qualifier, has outlasted marathon man Daniil Medvedev in an astonishing Australian Open boilover, sending the three-time finalist spinning out of the tournament in an exhausting, early-hours epic.
With the clock ticking towards 3am on Friday, the Californian teen, who'd looked down and out after the fifth seed made one of his trademark comebacks, found remarkable mental and physical reserves to pull off a 6-3 7-6 (7-4) 6-7 (8-10) 1-6 7-6 (10-7) triumph in 4 hours 49 minutes on Margaret Court Arena.
A healthy-sized, if bleary-eyed crowd, stayed on, transfixed by the drama as world No.121 Learner – given the memorable name by his maths teacher mum – ended up the teacher, giving a lesson in indefatigability to the out-of-sorts king of the stayers, who'd earlier been in racquet-chucking mode again.
Facebook Twitter Whatsapp Reddit Email Share
"I was definitely hoping it wasn't going to go a fifth-set breaker," smiled Tien, who'd only won his first grand slam match a couple of days earlier but is now the youngest American man in the third round in Melbourne since 18-year-old Pete Sampras in 1990. .
"Honestly in the fourth set, I just had to pee…
News

author: Times Now Digital
title: Controversial Temple Tax Bill Defeated In Karnataka Legislative Council Amid Opposition Uproar | India News, Times Now
text: Congress Suffers Blow As Karnataka Temple Tax Proposal Defeated In Upper House The bill, which had previously passed in the state assembly, aimed to collect a 10% tax from temples with revenues over ₹1 crore and a 5% tax from those generating incomes between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore. The defeat in the legislative council comes amid accusations of the Congress government implementing policies detrimental to Hindu interests. Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah (File image) Photo : PTI In Karnataka, the Congress-led government faced a setback as a bill proposing a 10% tax on the income of temples with revenues exceeding ₹1 crore was rejected in the state legislative council. The bill, named the 'Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Bill 2024,' had caused controversy, with the BJP opposition branding it as 'Anti-Hindu.' The legislation, having previously passed in the state assembly, aimed to impose a 10% tax on temples with revenues over ₹1 crore and a 5% tax on those earning between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 crore. The defeat in the legislative council raised accusations of the Congress government implementing policies perceived as detrimental to Hindu interests. The BJP-led National Democratic Alliance, holding a majority in the legislative council with 35 MLCs compared to Congress's 30, played a crucial role in the bill's rejection. The JD(S) contributed eight MLCs, and there was one independent candidate, with one seat remaining vacant. Amid criticism from the BJP, state ministers Ramalinga Reddy and Dinesh Gundu Rao defended the bill's amendments. Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy accused the BJP of being "anti-Hindu" and noted that similar amendments were made during their tenure in 2011. Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao argued that the bill aimed to benefit temples, dismissing BJP's opposition as misleading. Former Chief Minister Yediyurappa questioned the scrutiny of only Hindu temples' incomes, raising concerns about fairness in comparison to other religions. In response to allegations, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed the claims as "misrepresented," asserting that they were intended to "mislead the public" and "polarize people along communal lines for political leverage." author: @cronista
title: Una intensa tormenta se aproxima el fin de semana y afectar\u00e1 a todas las actividades al aire libre
text: Durante el festivo de Todos los Santos, la Agencia Estatal de Meteorológica (Aemet) ha emitido alertas por lluvias intensas en varias regiones del país. La situación genera complicaciones en los desplazamientos y la vida cotidiana.La Depresión Aislada en Niveles Altos (DANA) seguirá activa, trayendo consigo lluvias significativas en múltiples zonas de España. Se han actualizado los avisos por fenómenos meteorológicos adversos y ha extendido a todas las islas del archipiélago balear (Mallorca, Menorca, Ibiza y Formentera) el nivel "naranja" (riesgo importante) debido a las fuertes precipitaciones que se van a registrar durante el día. El viernes se anticipa como uno de los días más complicados en cuanto a condiciones climáticas, con intensas lluvias esperadas en el suroeste de la península. En Huelva, por ejemplo, se pronostica una acumulación de hasta 40 litros por metro cuadrado. Las regiones del Mediterráneo también se verán impactadas, lo que eleva el riesgo de inundaciones y desbordamientos en aéreas vulnerables.ALERTA | Fuertes lluvias se aproximan a varias zonas del paísEn el sur de Cataluña y el norte de la Comunidad Valenciana se encuentran en el centro de la alerta meteorológica. En estas áreas, las lluvias podrían superar los 100 litros por metro cuadrado, lo que incrementa el riesgo de inundaciones. La AEMET ha instado a los ciudadanos a evitar lugares propensos a desbordamientos y a mantenerse informados sobre el estado de las carreteras. Los restos de la Dana causando destrozos en Valencia. Fuente: EFE.Además, el archipiélago balear no quedará exento de los efectos de la DANA, con pronósticos que indican la posibilidad de lluvias intensas, acumulando hasta 120 litros en cortos períodos. Las autoridades locales recomiendan a residentes y turistas extremar la precaución en estas condiciones.01/11 09:01 #AEMET #FMA nivel naranja por lluvias y/o tormentas para hoy en Baleares, C. Valenciana, Andalucía y Cataluña . . Imagen en vigor a las 09:01 (tabla actualizada haciendo CLIC EN LA IMAGEN), o visite https://t.co/aIJV7DDYto https://t.co/zhHdwRqL19— AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) November 1, 2024 En Andalucía sigue activado la alerta roja, que representa "riesgo extremo" de alerta, ante las lluvias torrenciales que se registran desde primera hora en muchos puntos de la provincia de Huelva, y alerta naranja (riesgo importante) se extiende a muchos lugares de la comunidad.01/11 12:01 #AEMET #FMA nivel rojo por lluvias para hoy en Andalucía . Imagen en vigor a las 12:01 (tabla actualizada haciendo CLIC EN LA IMAGEN), o visite https://t.co/aIJV7DDYto https://t.co/mPnZCNQ19f— AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) November 1, 2024 ¿Cuál es el pronóstico para el fin de semana?El sábado se mantendrá la inestabilidad, con lluvias persistentes en Cataluña y la Comunidad Valenciana. Aunque se prevén precipitaciones en otras regiones, como el sur de España, su intensidad será menor. Se aconseja seguir las recomendaciones de Protección Civil, especialmente para quienes planeen viajar durante el puente.¿Cuál es el pronóstico para el fin de semana? fuente: archivo.A partir del domingo, la DANA comenzará a debilitarse, brindando una ligera mejora en las condiciones meteorológicas para gran parte del país. Sin embargo, aún se esperan chubascos en el Levante, Cataluña y Baleares. Para el martes, se prevé una notable mejora, aunque no se descartan algunos episodios de lluvia en la región mediterránea. Las temperaturas también podrían experimentar un leve aumento, ofreciendo un respiro frente a las intensas lluvias del fin de semana.

author: Kim Rankin
title: Boston College Baseball Shuts Out Northeastern
text:
Boston College Baseball Shuts Out Northeastern
The Boston College Eagles (9-9, 2-4 ACC) baseball team won its second straight game with a 6-0 victory over the Northeastern Huskies (12-7) on Wednesday evening.
The Eagles put their first run of the day on the board in the bottom of the first inning on an RBI single by first baseman Kyle Wolff.
After going scoreless in the next two frames, Boston College plated three runs in the fourth to extend its lead.
The first score came from an RBI single by catcher Gunnar Johnson and the second came on an RBI single by designated hitter Owen DeShazo. Third baseman Patrick Roche brought in the final run of the inning after being hit by a pitch with the bases loaded.
The Eagles tacked on two final runs in the fifth to cap off the day on an RBI single by shortstop Sam McNulty and an RBI groundout by Johnson.
Left-handed pitcher Brady Miller started on the mound for Boston College. In his first start of his collegiate career, the freshman went five innings and allowed three hits, walked one batter, and struck out six. Miller earned the win.
JD Ogden and Alex Bryant entered the game out of the bullpen. Ogden allowed just two hits while Bryant allowed zero in two innings apiece.
The victory marks the Eagles’ first shutout win of the season and moves them back to .500 on the year.
Next up, Boston College starts a series against the No. 17 UNC Tar Heels on Friday afternoon at Harrington Athletics Village. First pitch is set for 3 p.m. ET on ACCNX.

author: Brandy Perez
title: Biden-Harris Admin’s Border Crisis Was by Design
text:
Unprecedented numbers of violent gang members, drug cartel operatives, and aliens on the terror watchlist are among the estimated 11.6 million illegal aliens expected to have entered the United States during the Biden-Harris administration, a report released Wednesday by the House Committee on Homeland Security states.
President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris’ open border policy and their exploitation of U.S. asylum laws allowed millions of unvetted and unlawful aliens to bypass American immigration laws, risking the lives of many Americans, according to the jaw-dropping data in “Crisis by Design: A Comprehensive Look at the Biden-Harris Administration’s Unprecedented Border Crisis.”
The committee reported that U.S. Border Patrol arrested 52,755 illegal aliens with criminal records since the start of fiscal year 2021. Although three months remain until the end of the Biden-Harris term, the data reflects approximately 30,000 more individuals with criminal backgrounds were arrested by Border Patrol in comparison to fiscal years 2017-2021.
Americans have fallen victim to the rising number of violent offenses committed by criminal aliens since the start of fiscal year 2021. Convicted criminal alien encounters have skyrocketed over the course of the Biden-Harris administration, as seen in the data visualization graph below published by The Heritage Foundation from U.S. Customs and Border Protection reports.
(The Heritage Foundation from U.S. Customs and Border Protection data.) For example, CBP’s illegal drug possession and trafficking statistics total 7,846 recorded encounters from 2021-2024.
Reports of crimes committed by illegal aliens, including rape, murder, and narcotics smuggling, are detailed in “Crisis by Design.”
Josephine Dunn lost her daughter to fentanyl poisoning in 2021 and told the committee, “In my humble opinion, Mr. Mayorkas’ border policy is partially responsible for my daughter’s death,” referring to the secretary of homeland security.
Biden’s border has facilitated the drug trafficking trade and resulted in roughly 200,000 Americans reported dead since 2021 because of fentanyl poisoning, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Additionally, 1,339 documented illegal alien convictions for sexual offenses and 178 illegal alien convictions for murder and manslaughter have been reported since the start of fiscal year 2021, according to CBP.
Witnesses to some of the horrific consequences of our open borders testified before a House Committee on Homeland Security hearing Wednesday. Among them were a mother who lost her child to violent rape and murder at the hands of an illegal alien and border town leaders left struggling to handle a crisis that overwhelms their local communities.
These are the voices that Biden and Harris ignore.
Patty Morin stated in her testimony that the administration never once reached out to offer condolences for the loss of her daughter, Rachel Morin, who was tragically raped and murdered by an alien who illegally entered this country under Biden-Harris policies.
The administration also ignored the expert advice given to the Biden transition team in 2020-2021, according to transcribed interview excerpts within the committee report. Instead, the Biden transition team focused on “dismantling” President Donald Trump’s immigration policies.
Biden repealed the effective anti-asylum fraud tool, the “Remain in Mexico” program, and instead implemented the “catch and release” policy that allowed inadmissible aliens into the U.S. without detaining them. The Left’s opposition to Trump defined Biden’s agenda as he, along with Harris and Mayorkas, opened our borders to millions of inadmissible aliens.
The White House acted in an unprecedented manner to “diminish the security along our southern border,” according to former Border Patrol Chief Rodney Scott’s interview published in the committee report. Scott also concurred with other expert witnesses that the current state of our border was avoidable and was “a crisis by design.”
Former Department of Homeland Security officials also testified to the committee that the Biden-Harris administration restricted federal agencies from enforcing immigration laws—hauntingly described by the committee as the “gutting of interior enforcement.”
The White House’s engineered crisis left law enforcement officers feeling unsupported, resulting in 4,000 Border Patrol personnel choosing early retirement, according to the committee report. This number doubles the retirement rates during the Trump and Barack Obama presidencies.
The House Committee on Homeland Security’s report highlights the devastating consequences of Biden and Harris’ open border policies. American communities are left struggling with increased crime and drugs, overcrowded schools and emergency rooms, housing shortages, higher taxes, and a severe distrust in the current administration’s willingness to protect Americans.
According to the committee, the “willful decimation of border security” will be how the Biden-Harris administration will be remembered throughout history.

author: Casa Editorial El Tiempo
title: Flamengo le dio vuelta el partido a RB Bragantino con un 2-1 | Otras Ligas de Fútbol | Futbolred
text:
RB Bragantino tropezó este miércoles ante Flamengo, en la fecha 16 del Brasileirao, y el partido terminó 1-2 a favor de la visita. En el minuto 0 del segundo tiempo, Lucas Barbosa marcó el 1 a 0 para RB Bragantino anotando tras una jugada. Con un gol de cabeza y otro de jugada de Léo Pereira (20' de la segunda mitad) y de Wesley França (39' de la misma etapa), Flamengo salió a tiempo del desconcierto, revirtió el tanteador y selló el 2 a 1 para desatar el festejo de sus simpatizantes.
La figura del partido fue Léo Pereira. El defensor de Flamengo fue importante por convertir 1 gol.
Wesley França dejó su marca como un defensor crucial. El defensor de Flamengo fue importante por convertir 1 gol.
El estratega de RB Bragantino, Fernando Seabra, paró al once inicial con una formación 4-5-1 con Cleiton en el arco; José Hurtado, Pedro Henrique, Guzmán Rodriguez y Guilherme Lopes en la línea defensiva; Eric Ramires, Gabriel, Lucas Barbosa, Jhon Jhon y Henry Mosquera en el medio; y Eduardo Sasha en el ataque.
Por su parte, los elegidos por Filipe Kasmirski salieron al campo de juego con un esquema 4-3-3 con Agustín Rossi bajo los tres palos; Wesley França, Léo Ortiz, Léo Pereira y Guillermo Varela en defensa; Evertton, Giorgian De Arrascaeta y Jorginho en la mitad de cancha; y Luiz Araújo, Pedro y Bruno Henrique en la delantera.
El juez elegido para dirigir el partido en el estadio Cícero de Souza Marques fue Davi Lacerda.
Para la siguiente fecha, RB Bragantino actuará de visitante frente a Fortaleza, mientras que Flamengo recibirá a Atlético Mineiro.
Con este resultado, el anfitrión acumula 27 puntos a lo largo del certamen y ocupa el cuarto puesto. Por su parte, la visita suma 33 unidades y se ubica en el segundo lugar.
Cambios en RB Bragantino- 25' 1T - Salió Henry Mosquera por Vinicinho
- 45' 2T - Salió Pedro Henrique por Eduardo Santos
- 67' 2T - Salieron Eduardo Sasha por Isidro Pitta y Eric Ramires por Bruno Praxedes
- 79' 2T - Salieron Eduardo Santos por Gustavo Marques y Lucas Barbosa por Fabinho
- 23' 2T Cleiton (Conducta antideportiva)
- 61' 2T - Salieron Luiz Araújo por Wallace Yan y Guillermo Varela por Matías Viña
- 87' 2T - Salió Pedro por Juninho Vieira
- 2' 2T Jorginho (Conducta antideportiva), 22' 2T Evertton (Conducta antideportiva), 31' 2T Léo Pereira (Conducta antideportiva), 42' 2T Pedro (Demorar el juego) y 43' 2T Wesley França (Quitarse la camiseta)

author: Andrew Linde, Total Apex Gaming
title: Deltarune Coming to New Nintendo Switch 2 in Booming Direct
text:
Many people have played and thoroughly enjoyed Deltarune. It’s a beautiful game with a wonderful story, but there hasn’t been any content for a few years. However, in the recent April 2nd Nintendo Direct, there were many games announced for the upcoming Nintendo Switch 2. After much anticipation, Toby Fox, the creator of the very popular indie games Undertale and Deltarune, has officially announced the new chapters for Deltarune, those being Chapters 3 and 4. Fans have been waiting since September of 2021 for these new additions to the franchise, and fans were sent into much excitement upon this announcement!
Deltarune’s gameplay has always had a unique feel to it, which set it apart from other RPGs, including Undertale. The newest chapters are sure to continue and refine the mechanics that have been established while also expanding onto newer and unique mechanics. New items and abilities will open up fresh strategies, offering a variety of ways that will suit anyone and everyone! That’s not all, though! As seen in the reveal trailer, there appear to be more mini-games and scenes for players to experience, such as the rhythm game where the trio plays different parts of a song! (Susie goes crazy on the drums, for the record)
As expected, the trio of Kris, Susie, and Ralsei return and continue their adventure, along with their (not actual, more honorary) party member Lancer. Enemies spared and befriended from previous chapters also return, such as Rudin and Hathy from Chapter 1. Most notable of them all is Queen, who is – spoiler – the main antagonist of Chapter 2. The new antagonists, as of writing this, appear to be a TV with a sinister smile and laugh for Chapter 3. For Chapter 4, the only hint in the trailer is this horde of black creatures with a white circle for a face chasing Susie and Kris. As of now, no one can say for sure…
In classic Toby Fox action, he’ll be sure to bring new and stellar soundtracks for the newest releases. Toby Fox’s compositions always continue to shine, from somber melodies, upbeat tracks, and to energetic battle tracks, there will be many new additions to be had. While there are sure to be returning tracks, like the track for Hometown and Ralsei’s Castle, there are bound to be many unique hits!
Apart from what’s written above, we’ll be able to see a deeper dive into Deltarune’s story. Chapters 3 and 4 are sure to expand on the lore and mystery behind said story. Players will be able to experience new Dark Worlds and the unique charm that comes with each one. Not only that, but Chapters 3 and 4 will most likely have secret bosses, like Jevil from Chapter 1 and Spamton NEO from Chapter 2. Along with the Snowgrave route in Chapter 2, there may be other paths to look forward to in the new releases. There will be many secrets to be unwound!
While fans wait in anticipation for Chapters 3 and 4 to release, that begs an inevitable question: What comes next? Toby Fox isn’t going to give away too much about future chapters. It’s more than clear that the story is far from over. It appears that Chapters 5 through 7 are planned out. Chapter 5 was originally going to be released alongside 3 and 4, but it was cut and set for a later, unannounced release date (as of now). At the very least, the new releases have reignited the Deltarune hype and will set the stage for what will eventually be later chapters.
While still a couple of months away from actually being released, many fans’ reactions have proved that it’s been worth the several-year wait. With new mysteries to solve, special mechanics to be introduced, and the ever-unforgettable cast of characters that’ll keep expanding as Chapters 3 and 4 release, the legacy of Deltarune (and, to an extent, Undertale) will continue. Whether you’ve been following since the start of Undertale or are jumping in for the very first time, there’s no better time than now to experience the masterpiece that is Deltarune.

author: UOL
title: Lagoa dos Patos inunda bairros; RS tem mais de 400 mil fora de casa por causa das chuvas
text:
Cotidiano Lagoa dos Patos inunda bairros; RS tem mais de 400 mil fora de casa por causa das chuvas São Paulo 10/05/2024 12h32 Mais de 400 mil gaúchos estão fora de casa afetados pela maior tragédia climática do Estado. Nesta sexta-feira, 10, a Defesa Civil divulgou que 337.116 pessoas estão desalojadas e outras 69.617 em abrigos. O aumento na quantidade de afetados pelas enchentes ocorre em um momento de elevação do nível da Lagoa dos Patos e queda de temperatura no Estado.
A Defesa Civil emitiu na noite desta quinta-feira (9) um alerta com a orientação para quem mora em regiões próximas à lagoa, ou em áreas com histórico de alagamentos ou inundações, para que saiam de suas casas com antecedência e busquem um local seguro. No município de Rio Grande, por exemplo, vários bairros estão inundados. As principais ruas do entorno do centro histórico estão bloqueadas.
O nível da lagoa vem aumentando nos últimos dias e chegou a 1,84m às 16h de quinta-feira em Rio Grande, de acordo com os registros do Serviço Geológico do Brasil.
O Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet) em conjunto com o Centro Nacional de Monitoramento e Alertas de Desastres Naturais (Cemaden), o Centro Nacional de Gerenciamento de Riscos e Desastres (Cenad) e o Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (Inpe) também emitiram na quinta-feira uma nota técnica na qual alertam sobre os riscos geo-hidrológicos, sobretudo na região da Lagoa dos Patos, que recebe as águas dos rios e do Guaíba.
De acordo com os órgãos, o avanço de uma frente por Santa Catarina e a entrada de um ar mais frio pelo Rio Grande do Sul provocaram queda de temperatura no Estado e uma virada dos ventos "desfavorecendo o escoamento da água da lagoa em direção ao oceano, desta forma, a preparação dos municípios para inundação gradual na região de Pelotas, Rio Grande e arredores deve ser redobrada."
Frio
Ainda segundo o Inmet, as temperaturas mínimas variam de 4°C a 8°C nas regiões mais ao Sul do Estado. Nas demais áreas, as temperaturas mínimas variam de 10°C a 15°C. O frio é considerado um problema adicional em meio à tragédia climática por causa do risco de hipotermia às pessoas que ainda não foram resgatadas.

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Bridging Cultures: Non-Profit Teaches Transracial Adoptive Parents Black Hair Care
text:
Transracial adoptions, where children are placed with parents of a different racial makeup, are increasing in the U.S., sparking a unique challenge for many adoptive parents: learning to care for their child's hair. This challenge was faced by Jessica, a Northern European descent mother, who adopted her daughter Autumn. Recognizing the importance of hair care in maintaining a child's cultural identity, Jessica sought help to learn the essentials of Black hair care.
Empowering Parents, Celebrating Identity
Styles4Kidz, a Chicago-based non-profit founded by Tamekia Swint, steps in to fill this knowledge gap by offering workshops to transracial adoptive parents on the intricacies of Black hair care. The organization's mission is not only to educate parents but also to ensure that children feel a sense of belonging and confidence in their cultural identity. According to Swint, proper hair care is crucial for a child's mental and emotional health, impacting their interaction with the world.
Celebrities and Influencers Join the Cause
A-list celebrities like Angelina Jolie and Kristin Davis, along with influencers like Kendall Mariah, have publicly shared their journeys of learning Black hair care for their adopted children. Their stories highlight the broader significance of hair care in bonding and cultural respect, drawing attention to the need for resources and education in this area.
Looking Ahead: The Future of Transracial Adoption Support
As the number of transracial adoptions continues to rise, the demand for culturally sensitive parenting resources like those offered by Styles4Kidz will likely increase. The organization's work underscores the importance of embracing and celebrating cultural differences within families, aiming to foster a more inclusive understanding of race and identity across the U.S.

organizations.name: non-profit teaches transracial adoptive parents black hair care transracial
